1.verse: From Adam to Abraham - Adam was the father of Seth. Seth was the father of Enosh. Enosh was the father of Kenan.

2.verse: Kenan was the father of Mahalalel. Mahalalel was the father of Jared. Jared was the father of Enoch.

3.verse: Enoch was the father of Methuselah. Methuselah was the father of Lamech, and Lamech was the father of Noah.

4.verse: The sons of Noah were Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

5.verse: Japheth’s sons were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

6.verse: Gomer’s sons were Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

7.verse: Javan’s sons were Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.

8.verse: Ham’s sons were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

9.verse: Cush’s sons were Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah, and Sabteca. Raamah’s sons were Sheba and Dedan.

10.verse: Cush was the father of Nimrod, who grew up to become a mighty warrior on the earth.

11.verse: Mizraim was the father of the Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites, and Naphtuhites,

12.verse: Pathrusites, Casluhites, and Caphtorites. (The Philistines came from the Casluhites.)

13.verse: Canaan’s first child was Sidon. He was also the father of the Hittites,

14.verse: Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites,

15.verse: Hivites, Arkites, Sinites,

16.verse: Arvadites, Zemarites, and Hamathites.

17.verse: Shem’s sons were Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram. Aram’s sons were Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.

18.verse: Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, who was the father of Eber.

19.verse: Eber had two sons. One son was named Peleg, because the people on the earth were divided into different languages during his life. Peleg’s brother was named Joktan.

20.verse: Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

21.verse: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

22.verse: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,

23.verse: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were Joktan’s sons.

24.verse: The family line included Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,

25.verse: Eber, Peleg, Reu,

26.verse: Serug, Nahor, Terah,

27.verse: and Abram, who was called Abraham.

28.verse: Abraham’s Family - Abraham’s sons were Isaac and Ishmael.

29.verse: These were the sons of Isaac and Ishmael. Ishmael’s first son was Nebaioth. His other sons were Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

31.verse: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These were Ishmael’s sons.

32.verse: Keturah, Abraham’s slave woman, gave birth to Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. Jokshan’s sons were Sheba and Dedan.

33.verse: Midian’s sons were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were descendants of Keturah.

34.verse: Abraham was the father of Isaac, and Isaac’s sons were Esau and Israel.

35.verse: Esau’s sons were Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.

36.verse: Eliphaz’s sons were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna, and Amalek.

37.verse: Reuel’s sons were Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.

38.verse: The Edomites from Seir - Seir’s sons were Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.

39.verse: Lotan’s sons were Hori and Homam, and his sister was Timna.

40.verse: Shobal’s sons were Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam. Zibeon’s sons were Aiah and Anah.

41.verse: Anah’s son was Dishon. Dishon’s sons were Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Keran.

42.verse: Ezer’s sons were Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan. Dishan’s sons were Uz and Aran.

43.verse: The Kings of Edom - These kings ruled in Edom before there were kings in Israel. Bela son of Beor was king of Edom, and his city was named Dinhabah.

44.verse: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah became king. He was from Bozrah.

45.verse: When Jobab died, Husham became king. He was from the land of the Temanites.

46.verse: When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad became king, and his city was named Avith. Hadad defeated Midian in the country of Moab.

47.verse: When Hadad died, Samlah became king. He was from Masrekah.

48.verse: When Samlah died, Shaul became king. He was from Rehoboth by the river.

49.verse: When Shaul died, Baal-Hanan son of Acbor became king.

50.verse: When Baal-Hanan died, Hadad became king, and his city was named Pau. Hadad’s wife was named Mehetabel, and she was the daughter of Matred, who was the daughter of Me-Zahab.

51.verse: Then Hadad died. The leaders of the family groups of Edom were Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,

54.verse: Magdiel, and Iram. These were the leaders of Edom.

1.verse: Israel’s Family - The sons of Israel were Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,

2.verse: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

3.verse: Judah’s Family - Judah’s sons were Er, Onan, and Shelah. A Canaanite woman, the daughter of Shua, was their mother. Judah’s first son, Er, did what the LORD said was wicked, so the LORD put him to death.

4.verse: Judah’s daughter-in-law Tamar gave birth to Perez and Zerah. Judah was the father, so Judah had five sons.

5.verse: Perez’s sons were Hezron and Hamul.

6.verse: Zerah had five sons: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Darda.

7.verse: Carmi’s son was Achan, who caused trouble for Israel because he took things that had been given to the LORD to be destroyed.

8.verse: Ethan’s son was Azariah.

9.verse: Hezron’s sons were Jerahmeel, Ram, and Caleb.

10.verse: Ram was Amminadab’s father, and Amminadab was Nahshon’s father. Nahshon was the leader of the people of Judah.

11.verse: Nahshon was the father of Salmon, who was the father of Boaz.

12.verse: Boaz was the father of Obed, and Obed was the father of Jesse.

13.verse: Jesse’s first son was Eliab. His second son was Abinadab, his third was Shimea,

14.verse: his fourth was Nethanel, his fifth was Raddai,

15.verse: his sixth was Ozem, and his seventh son was David.

16.verse: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. Zeruiah’s three sons were Abishai, Joab, and Asahel.

17.verse: Abigail was the mother of Amasa, and his father was Jether, an Ishmaelite.

18.verse: Caleb’s Family - Caleb son of Hezron had children by his wife Azubah and by Jerioth. Caleb and Azubah’s sons were Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.

19.verse: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath. They had a son named Hur,

20.verse: who was the father of Uri, who was the father of Bezalel.

21.verse: Later, when Hezron was sixty years old, he married the daughter of Makir, Gilead’s father. Hezron had sexual relations with Makir’s daughter, and she had a son named Segub.

22.verse: Segub was the father of Jair. Jair controlled twenty-three cities in the country of Gilead.

23.verse: (But Geshur and Aram captured the Towns of Jair, as well as Kenath and the small towns around it—sixty towns in all.) All these were descendants of Makir, the father of Gilead.

24.verse: After Hezron died in Caleb Ephrathah, his wife Abijah had his son, named Ashhur. Ashhur became the father of Tekoa.

25.verse: Jerahmeel’s Family - Hezron’s first son was Jerahmeel. Jerahmeel’s sons were Ram, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah. Ram was Jerahmeel’s first son.

26.verse: Jerahmeel had another wife, named Atarah. She was the mother of Onam.

27.verse: Jerahmeel’s first son, Ram, had sons. They were Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.

28.verse: Onam’s sons were Shammai and Jada. Shammai’s sons were Nadab and Abishur.

29.verse: Abishur’s wife was named Abihail, and their sons were Ahban and Molid.

30.verse: Nadab’s sons were Seled and Appaim. Seled died without having children.

31.verse: Appaim’s son was Ishi, who became the father of Sheshan. Sheshan was the father of Ahlai.

32.verse: Jada was Shammai’s brother, and Jada’s sons were Jether and Jonathan. Jether died without having children.

33.verse: Jonathan’s sons were Peleth and Zaza. These were Jerahmeel’s descendants.

34.verse: Sheshan did not have any sons, only daughters. He had a servant from Egypt named Jarha.

35.verse: Sheshan let his daughter marry his servant Jarha, and she had a son named Attai.

36.verse: Attai was the father of Nathan. Nathan was the father of Zabad.

37.verse: Zabad was the father of Ephlal. Ephlal was the father of Obed.

38.verse: Obed was the father of Jehu. Jehu was the father of Azariah.

39.verse: Azariah was the father of Helez. Helez was the father of Eleasah.

40.verse: Eleasah was the father of Sismai. Sismai was the father of Shallum.

41.verse: Shallum was the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah was the father of Elishama.

42.verse: Caleb’s Family - Caleb was Jerahmeel’s brother. Caleb’s first son was Mesha. Mesha was the father of Ziph, and his son Mareshah was the father of Hebron.

43.verse: Hebron’s sons were Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.

44.verse: Shema was the father of Raham, who was the father of Jorkeam. Rekem was the father of Shammai.

45.verse: Shammai was the father of Maon, and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.

46.verse: Caleb’s slave woman was named Ephah, and she was the mother of Haran, Moza, and Gazez. Haran was the father of Gazez.

47.verse: Jahdai’s sons were Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.

48.verse: Caleb had another slave woman named Maacah. She was the mother of Sheber, Tirhanah,

49.verse: Shaaph, and Sheva. Shaaph was the father of Madmannah. Sheva was the father of Macbenah and Gibea. Caleb’s daughter was Acsah.

50.verse: These were Caleb’s descendants: Caleb’s son Hur was the first son of his mother Ephrathah. Hur’s sons were Shobal, Salma, and Hareph. Shobal was the father of Kiriath Jearim. Salma was the father of Bethlehem. And Hareph was the father of Beth Gader.

51.verse: These were Caleb’s descendants: Caleb’s son Hur was the first son of his mother Ephrathah. Hur’s sons were Shobal, Salma, and Hareph. Shobal was the father of Kiriath Jearim. Salma was the father of Bethlehem. And Hareph was the father of Beth Gader.

52.verse: Shobal was the father of Kiriath Jearim. Shobal’s descendants were Haroeh, half the Manahathites,

53.verse: and the family groups of Kiriath Jearim: the Ithrites, Puthites, Shumathites, and Mishraites. The Zorathites and the Eshtaolites came from the Mishraite people.

54.verse: Salma’s descendants were Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, half the Manahathites, and the Zorites.

55.verse: His descendants included the families who lived at Jabez, who wrote and copied important papers. They were called the Tirathites, Shimeathites, and Sucathites and were from the Kenite family group who came from Hammath. He was the father of the people living in Recab.

1.verse: David’s Family - These are David’s sons who were born in Hebron. The first was Amnon, whose mother was Ahinoam from Jezreel. The second son was Daniel, whose mother was Abigail from Carmel.

2.verse: The third son was Absalom, whose mother was Maacah daughter of Talmai, the king of Geshur. The fourth son was Adonijah, whose mother was Haggith.

3.verse: The fifth son was Shephatiah, whose mother was Abital. The sixth son was Ithream, whose mother was Eglah.

4.verse: These six sons of David were born to him in Hebron, where David ruled for seven and one-half years. David ruled in Jerusalem thirty-three years.

5.verse: These were his children who were born in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon—the four children of David and Bathsheba, Ammiel’s daughter.

6.verse: David’s other nine children were Ibhar, Elishua, Eliphelet, Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia, Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet.

7.verse: David’s other nine children were Ibhar, Elishua, Eliphelet, Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia, Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet.

8.verse: David’s other nine children were Ibhar, Elishua, Eliphelet, Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia, Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet.

9.verse: These were all of David’s sons, except for those born to his slave women. David also had a daughter named Tamar.

10.verse: The Kings of Judah - Solomon’s son was Rehoboam. Rehoboam’s son was Abijah. Abijah’s son was Asa. Asa’s son was Jehoshaphat.

11.verse: Jehoshaphat’s son was Jehoram. Jehoram’s son was Ahaziah. Ahaziah’s son was Joash.

12.verse: Joash’s son was Amaziah. Amaziah’s son was Azariah. Azariah’s son was Jotham.

13.verse: Jotham’s son was Ahaz. Ahaz’s son was Hezekiah. Hezekiah’s son was Manasseh.

14.verse: Manasseh’s son was Amon, and Amon’s son was Josiah.

15.verse: These were Josiah’s sons: His first son was Johanan, his second was Jehoiakim, his third was Zedekiah, and his fourth was Shallum.

16.verse: Jehoiakim was followed by Jehoiachin, and he was followed by Zedekiah.

17.verse: David’s Descendants After the Babylonian Captivity - Jehoiachin was taken as a prisoner. His sons were Shealtiel,

18.verse: Malkiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.

19.verse: Pedaiah’s sons were Zerubbabel and Shimei. Zerubbabel’s sons were Meshullam and Hananiah, and their sister was Shelomith.

20.verse: Zerubbabel also had five other sons: Hashubah, Ohel, Berekiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-Hesed.

21.verse: Hananiah’s descendants were Pelatiah and Jeshaiah, and the sons of Rephaiah, Arnan, Obadiah, and Shecaniah.

22.verse: Shecaniah’s son was Shemaiah. Shemaiah’s sons were Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat. There were six in all.

23.verse: Neariah had three sons: Elioenai, Hizkiah, and Azrikam.

24.verse: Elioenai had seven sons: Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani.

1.verse: Other Family Groups of Judah - Judah’s descendants were Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.

2.verse: Reaiah was Shobal’s son. Reaiah was the father of Jahath, and Jahath was the father of Ahumai and Lahad. They were the family groups of the Zorathite people.

3.verse: Hur was the oldest son of Caleb and his wife Ephrathah. Hur was the leader of Bethlehem. His three sons were Etam, Penuel, and Ezer. Etam’s sons were Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash. They had a sister named Hazzelelponi. Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer was the father of Hushah.

4.verse: Hur was the oldest son of Caleb and his wife Ephrathah. Hur was the leader of Bethlehem. His three sons were Etam, Penuel, and Ezer. Etam’s sons were Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash. They had a sister named Hazzelelponi. Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer was the father of Hushah.

5.verse: Tekoa’s father was Ashhur. Ashhur had two wives named Helah and Naarah.

6.verse: The sons of Ashhur and Naarah were Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the descendants of Naarah.

7.verse: Helah’s sons were Zereth, Zohar, Ethnan,

8.verse: and Koz. Koz was the father of Anub, Hazzobebah, and the Aharhel family group. Aharhel was the son of Harum.

9.verse: There was a man named Jabez, who was respected more than his brothers. His mother named him Jabez because she said, “I was in much pain when I gave birth to him.”

10.verse: Jabez prayed to the God of Israel, “Please do good things for me and give me more land. Stay with me, and don’t let anyone hurt me. Then I won’t have any pain.” And God did what Jabez had asked.

11.verse: Kelub, Shuhah’s brother, was the father of Mehir. Mehir was the father of Eshton.

12.verse: Eshton was the father of Beth Rapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah. Tehinnah was the father of the people from the town of Nahash. These people were from Recah.

13.verse: The sons of Kenaz were Othniel and Seraiah. Othniel’s sons were Hathath and Meonothai.

14.verse: Meonothai was the father of Ophrah. Seraiah was the father of Joab. Joab was the ancestor of the people from Craftsmen’s Valley, named that because the people living there were craftsmen.

15.verse: Caleb was Jephunneh’s son. Caleb’s sons were Iru, Elah, and Naam. Elah’s son was Kenaz.

16.verse: Jehallelel’s sons were Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.

17.verse: Ezrah’s sons were Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon. Mered married Bithiah, the daughter of the king of Egypt. The children of Mered and Bithiah were Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah. Ishbah was the father of Eshtemoa. Mered also had a wife from Judah, who gave birth to Jered, Heber, and Jekuthiel. Jered became the father of Gedor. Heber became the father of Soco. And Jekuthiel became the father of Zanoah.

18.verse: Ezrah’s sons were Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon. Mered married Bithiah, the daughter of the king of Egypt. The children of Mered and Bithiah were Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah. Ishbah was the father of Eshtemoa. Mered also had a wife from Judah, who gave birth to Jered, Heber, and Jekuthiel. Jered became the father of Gedor. Heber became the father of Soco. And Jekuthiel became the father of Zanoah.

19.verse: Hodiah’s wife was Naham’s sister. The sons of Hodiah’s wife were Eshtemoa and the father of Keilah. Keilah was from the Garmite people, and Eshtemoa was from the Maacathite people.

20.verse: Shimon’s sons were Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-Hanan, and Tilon. Ishi’s sons were Zoheth and Ben-Zoheth.

21.verse: Shelah was Judah’s son. Shelah’s sons were Er, Laadah, Jokim, the men from Cozeba, Joash, and Saraph. Er was the father of Lecah. Laadah was the father of Mareshah and the family groups of linen workers at Beth Ashbea. Joash and Saraph ruled in Moab and Jashubi Lehem. The writings about this family are very old.

22.verse: Shelah was Judah’s son. Shelah’s sons were Er, Laadah, Jokim, the men from Cozeba, Joash, and Saraph. Er was the father of Lecah. Laadah was the father of Mareshah and the family groups of linen workers at Beth Ashbea. Joash and Saraph ruled in Moab and Jashubi Lehem. The writings about this family are very old.

23.verse: These sons of Shelah were potters. They lived in Netaim and Gederah and worked for the king.

24.verse: Simeon’s Children - Simeon’s sons were Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, and Shaul.

25.verse: Shaul’s son was Shallum. Shallum’s son was Mibsam. Mibsam’s son was Mishma.

26.verse: Mishma’s son was Hammuel. Hammuel’s son was Zaccur. Zaccur’s son was Shimei.

27.verse: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters, but his brothers did not have many children, so there were not as many people in their family group as there were in Judah.

28.verse: Shimei’s children lived in Beersheba, Moladah, Hazar Shual,

31.verse: Beth Marcaboth, Hazar Susim, Beth Biri, and Shaaraim. They lived in these cities until David became king.

32.verse: The five villages near these cities were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Token, and Ashan.

33.verse: There were also other villages as far away as Baalath. This is where they lived. And they wrote the history of their family.

34.verse: The men in this list were leaders of their family groups: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah, Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah (Joshibiah was the son of Seraiah, who was the son of Asiel), Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah, and Ziza. (Ziza was the son of Shiphi, who was the son of Allon. Allon was the son of Jedaiah, who was the son of Shimri. And Shimri was the son of Shemaiah.) These families grew very large.

35.verse: The men in this list were leaders of their family groups: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah, Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah (Joshibiah was the son of Seraiah, who was the son of Asiel), Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah, and Ziza. (Ziza was the son of Shiphi, who was the son of Allon. Allon was the son of Jedaiah, who was the son of Shimri. And Shimri was the son of Shemaiah.) These families grew very large.

36.verse: The men in this list were leaders of their family groups: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah, Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah (Joshibiah was the son of Seraiah, who was the son of Asiel), Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah, and Ziza. (Ziza was the son of Shiphi, who was the son of Allon. Allon was the son of Jedaiah, who was the son of Shimri. And Shimri was the son of Shemaiah.) These families grew very large.

37.verse: The men in this list were leaders of their family groups: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah, Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah (Joshibiah was the son of Seraiah, who was the son of Asiel), Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah, and Ziza. (Ziza was the son of Shiphi, who was the son of Allon. Allon was the son of Jedaiah, who was the son of Shimri. And Shimri was the son of Shemaiah.) These families grew very large.

38.verse: The men in this list were leaders of their family groups: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah, Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah (Joshibiah was the son of Seraiah, who was the son of Asiel), Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah, and Ziza. (Ziza was the son of Shiphi, who was the son of Allon. Allon was the son of Jedaiah, who was the son of Shimri. And Shimri was the son of Shemaiah.) These families grew very large.

39.verse: They went outside the city of Gedor to the east side of the valley to look for pasture for their flocks.

40.verse: They found good pastures with plenty of grass, and the land was open country and peaceful and quiet. Ham’s descendants had lived there in the past.

41.verse: These men who were listed came to Gedor while Hezekiah was king of Judah. They fought against the Hamites, destroying their tents, and also against the Meunites who lived there, and completely destroyed them. So there are no Meunites there even today. Then these men began to live there, because there was pasture for their flocks.

42.verse: Ishi’s sons, Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, led five hundred of the Simeonites and attacked the people living in the mountains of Edom.

43.verse: They killed the few Amalekites who were still alive. From that time until now these Simeonites have lived in Edom.

1.verse: Reuben’s Children - Reuben was Israel’s first son. Reuben should have received the special privileges of the oldest son, but he had sexual relations with his father’s slave woman. So those special privileges were given to Joseph’s sons. (Joseph was a son of Israel.) In the family history Reuben’s name is not listed as the first son.

2.verse: Judah became stronger than his brothers, and a leader came from his family. But Joseph’s family received the privileges that belonged to the oldest son.

3.verse: Reuben was Israel’s first son. Reuben’s sons were Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

4.verse: These were the children of Joel: Shemaiah was Joel’s son. Gog was Shemaiah’s son. Shimei was Gog’s son.

5.verse: Micah was Shimei’s son. Reaiah was Micah’s son. Baal was Reaiah’s son.

6.verse: Beerah was Baal’s son. Beerah was a leader of the tribe of Reuben. Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria captured him and took him away.

7.verse: Joel’s brothers and all his family groups are listed just as they are written in their family histories: Jeiel was the first, then Zechariah,

8.verse: and Bela. (Bela was the son of Azaz. Azaz was the son of Shema, and Shema was the son of Joel.) They lived in the area of Aroer all the way to Nebo and Baal Meon.

9.verse: Bela’s people lived to the east—as far as the edge of the desert, which is beside the Euphrates River—because they had too many cattle for the land of Gilead.

10.verse: When Saul was king, Bela’s people fought a war against the Hagrite people and defeated them. Then Bela’s people lived in the tents that had belonged to the Hagrites in all the area east of Gilead.

11.verse: Gad’s Children - The people from the tribe of Gad lived near the Reubenites. The Gadites lived in the area of Bashan all the way to Salecah.

12.verse: Joel was the main leader, Shapham was second, and then Janai and Shaphat were leaders in Bashan.

13.verse: The seven relatives in their families were Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, and Eber.

14.verse: They were the descendants of Abihail. Abihail was Huri’s son. Huri was Jaroah’s son. Jaroah was Gilead’s son. Gilead was Michael’s son. Michael was Jeshishai’s son. Jeshishai was Jahdo’s son, and Jahdo was the son of Buz.

15.verse: Ahi was Abdiel’s son, and Abdiel was Guni’s son. Ahi was the leader of their family.

16.verse: The Gadites lived in Gilead, Bashan and the small towns around it, and on all the pasturelands in the Plain of Sharon all the way to the borders.

17.verse: All these names were written in the family history of Gad during the time Jotham was king of Judah and Jeroboam was king of Israel.

18.verse: Soldiers Skilled in War - There were forty-four thousand seven hundred sixty soldiers from the tribes of Reuben and Gad and East Manasseh who carried shields and swords and bows. They were skilled in war.

19.verse: They started a war against the Hagrites and the people of Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab.

20.verse: The men from the tribes of Manasseh, Reuben, and Gad prayed to God during the war, asking him to help them. So he helped them because they trusted him. He handed over to them the Hagrites and all those who were with them.

21.verse: They took the animals that belonged to the Hagrites: fifty thousand camels, two hundred fifty thousand sheep, and two thousand donkeys. They also captured one hundred thousand people.

22.verse: Many Hagrites were killed because God helped the people of Reuben, Gad, and Manasseh. Then they lived there until Babylon captured them and took them away.

23.verse: East Manasseh - There were many people in East Manasseh, and they lived in the area of Bashan all the way to Baal Hermon, Senir, and Mount Hermon.

24.verse: These were the family leaders: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel. They were all strong, brave, and famous men, and leaders in their families.

25.verse: But they sinned against the God that their ancestors had worshiped. They began worshiping the gods of the people in that land, and those were the people God was destroying.

26.verse: So the God of Israel made Pul king of Assyria want to go to war. (Pul was also called Tiglath-Pileser.) He captured the people of Reuben, Gad, and East Manasseh, and he took them away to Halah, Habor, Hara, and near the Gozan River. They have lived there from that time until this day.

1.verse: Levi’s Children - Levi’s sons were Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

2.verse: Kohath’s sons were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

3.verse: Amram’s children were Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. Aaron’s sons were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

4.verse: Eleazar was the father of Phinehas. Phinehas was the father of Abishua.

5.verse: Abishua was the father of Bukki. Bukki was the father of Uzzi.

6.verse: Uzzi was the father of Zerahiah. Zerahiah was the father of Meraioth.

7.verse: Meraioth was the father of Amariah. Amariah was the father of Ahitub.

8.verse: Ahitub was the father of Zadok. Zadok was the father of Ahimaaz.

9.verse: Ahimaaz was the father of Azariah. Azariah was the father of Johanan.

10.verse: Johanan was the father of Azariah. (Azariah was a priest in the Temple Solomon built in Jerusalem.)

11.verse: Azariah was the father of Amariah. Amariah was the father of Ahitub.

12.verse: Ahitub was the father of Zadok. Zadok was the father of Shallum.

13.verse: Shallum was the father of Hilkiah. Hilkiah was the father of Azariah.

14.verse: Azariah was the father of Seraiah, and Seraiah was the father of Jehozadak.

15.verse: Jehozadak was forced to leave his home when the LORD sent Judah and Jerusalem into captivity under the control of Nebuchadnezzar.

16.verse: Levi’s sons were Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

17.verse: The names of Gershon’s sons were Libni and Shimei.

18.verse: Kohath’s sons were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

19.verse: Merari’s sons were Mahli and Mushi. This is a list of the family groups of Levi, listed by the name of the father of each group.

20.verse: Gershon’s son was Libni. Libni’s son was Jehath. Jehath’s son was Zimmah.

21.verse: Zimmah’s son was Joah. Joah’s son was Iddo. Iddo’s son was Zerah. And Zerah’s son was Jeatherai.

22.verse: Kohath’s son was Amminadab. Amminadab’s son was Korah. Korah’s son was Assir.

23.verse: Assir’s son was Elkanah. Elkanah’s son was Ebiasaph. Ebiasaph’s son was Assir.

24.verse: Assir’s son was Tahath. Tahath’s son was Uriel. Uriel’s son was Uzziah, and Uzziah’s son was Shaul.

25.verse: Elkanah’s sons were Amasai and Ahimoth.

26.verse: Ahimoth’s son was Elkanah. Elkanah’s son was Zophai. Zophai’s son was Nahath.

27.verse: Nahath’s son was Eliab. Eliab’s son was Jeroham. Jeroham’s son was Elkanah, and Elkanah’s son was Samuel.

28.verse: Samuel’s sons were Joel, the first son, and Abijah, the second son.

29.verse: Merari’s son was Mahli. Mahli’s son was Libni. Libni’s son was Shimei. Shimei’s son was Uzzah.

30.verse: Uzzah’s son was Shimea. Shimea’s son was Haggiah, and Haggiah’s son was Asaiah.

31.verse: The Temple Musicians - David chose some people to be in charge of the music in the house of the LORD. They began their work after the Ark of the Agreement was put there.

32.verse: They served by making music at the Holy Tent (also called the Meeting Tent), and they served until Solomon built the Temple of the LORD in Jerusalem. They followed the rules for their work.

33.verse: These are the musicians and their sons: From Kohath’s family there was Heman the singer. Heman was Joel’s son. Joel was Samuel’s son.

34.verse: Samuel was Elkanah’s son. Elkanah was Jeroham’s son. Jeroham was Eliel’s son. Eliel was Toah’s son.

35.verse: Toah was Zuph’s son. Zuph was Elkanah’s son. Elkanah was Mahath’s son. Mahath was Amasai’s son.

36.verse: Amasai was Elkanah’s son. Elkanah was Joel’s son. Joel was Azariah’s son. Azariah was Zephaniah’s son.

37.verse: Zephaniah was Tahath’s son. Tahath was Assir’s son. Assir was Ebiasaph’s son. Ebiasaph was Korah’s son.

38.verse: Korah was Izhar’s son. Izhar was Kohath’s son. Kohath was Levi’s son. Levi was Israel’s son.

39.verse: There was Heman’s helper Asaph, whose group stood by Heman’s right side. Asaph was Berekiah’s son. Berekiah was Shimea’s son.

40.verse: Shimea was Michael’s son. Michael was Baaseiah’s son. Baaseiah was Malkijah’s son.

41.verse: Malkijah was Ethni’s son. Ethni was Zerah’s son. Zerah was Adaiah’s son.

42.verse: Adaiah was Ethan’s son. Ethan was Zimmah’s son. Zimmah was Shimei’s son.

43.verse: Shimei was Jahath’s son. Jahath was Gershon’s son, and Gershon was Levi’s son.

44.verse: Merari’s family were the helpers of Heman and Asaph, and they stood by Heman’s left side. In this group was Ethan son of Kishi. Kishi was Abdi’s son. Abdi was Malluch’s son.

45.verse: Malluch was Hashabiah’s son. Hashabiah was Amaziah’s son. Amaziah was Hilkiah’s son.

46.verse: Hilkiah was Amzi’s son. Amzi was Bani’s son. Bani was Shemer’s son.

47.verse: Shemer was Mahli’s son. Mahli was Mushi’s son. Mushi was Merari’s son, and Merari was Levi’s son.

48.verse: The other Levites served by doing their own special work in the Holy Tent, the house of God.

49.verse: Aaron and his descendants offered the sacrifices on the altar of burnt offering and burned the incense on the altar of incense. They offered the sacrifices that removed the Israelites’ sins so they could belong to God. They did all the work in the Most Holy Place and followed all the laws that Moses, God’s servant, had commanded.

50.verse: These were Aaron’s sons: Eleazar was Aaron’s son. Phinehas was Eleazar’s son. Abishua was Phinehas’ son.

51.verse: Bukki was Abishua’s son. Uzzi was Bukki’s son. Zerahiah was Uzzi’s son.

52.verse: Meraioth was Zerahiah’s son. Amariah was Meraioth’s son. Ahitub was Amariah’s son.

53.verse: Zadok was Ahitub’s son, and Ahimaaz was Zadok’s son.

54.verse: Land for the Levites - These are the places where Aaron’s descendants lived. His descendants from the Kohath family group received the first share of the land.

55.verse: They were given the city of Hebron in Judah and the pastures around it,

56.verse: but the fields farther from the city and the villages near Hebron were given to Caleb son of Jephunneh.

57.verse: So the descendants of Aaron were given Hebron, one of the cities of safety. They also received the towns and pastures of Libnah, Jattir, Eshtemoa,

60.verse: They also received these towns and pastures from the tribe of Benjamin: Gibeon, Geba, Alemeth, and Anathoth. The Kohath family groups received a total of thirteen towns.

61.verse: The rest of the Kohath family group was given ten towns from the family groups of West Manasseh. The towns were chosen by throwing lots.

62.verse: The Gershon family group received thirteen towns from the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and the part of Manasseh living in Bashan.

63.verse: The Merari family group received twelve towns from the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun. Those towns were chosen by throwing lots.

64.verse: So the Israelites gave these towns and their pastures to the Levites.

65.verse: The towns from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin, which were named, were chosen by throwing lots.

66.verse: Some of the Kohath family groups received towns and pastures from the tribe of Ephraim.

67.verse: They received Shechem, one of the cities of safety, with its pastures in the mountains of Ephraim. They also received the towns and pastures of Gezer,

70.verse: The rest of the people in the Kohath family group received the towns of Aner and Bileam and their pastures from West Manasseh.

71.verse: From East Manasseh, the Gershon family received the towns and pastures of Golan in Bashan and Ashtaroth.

72.verse: From the tribe of Issachar, the Gershon family received the towns and pastures of Kedesh, Daberath, Ramoth, and Anem.

73.verse: From the tribe of Issachar, the Gershon family received the towns and pastures of Kedesh, Daberath, Ramoth, and Anem.

74.verse: From the tribe of Asher, the Gershon family received the towns and pastures of Mashal, Abdon, Hukok, and Rehob.

75.verse: From the tribe of Asher, the Gershon family received the towns and pastures of Mashal, Abdon, Hukok, and Rehob.

76.verse: From the tribe of Naphtali, the Gershon family received the towns and pastures of Kedesh in Galilee, Hammon, and Kiriathaim.

77.verse: The rest of the Levites, the people from the Merari family, received from the tribe of Zebulun the towns and pastures of Jokneam, Kartah, Rimmono, and Tabor.

78.verse: From the tribe of Reuben, the Merari family received the towns and pastures of Bezer in the desert, Jahzah, Kedemoth, and Mephaath. (The tribe of Reuben lived east of the Jordan River, across from Jericho.)

79.verse: From the tribe of Reuben, the Merari family received the towns and pastures of Bezer in the desert, Jahzah, Kedemoth, and Mephaath. (The tribe of Reuben lived east of the Jordan River, across from Jericho.)

80.verse: From the tribe of Gad, the Merari family received the towns and pastures of Ramoth in Gilead, Mahanaim, Heshbon, and Jazer.

81.verse: From the tribe of Gad, the Merari family received the towns and pastures of Ramoth in Gilead, Mahanaim, Heshbon, and Jazer.

1.verse: Issachar’s Children - Issachar had four sons: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron.

2.verse: Tola’s sons were Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Samuel, and they were leaders of their families. In the family history of Tola’s descendants, twenty-two thousand six hundred men were listed as fighting men during the time David was king.

3.verse: Uzzi’s son was Izrahiah. Izrahiah’s sons were Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Isshiah. All five of them were leaders.

4.verse: Their family history shows they had thirty-six thousand men ready to serve in the army, because they had many wives and children.

5.verse: The records of the family groups of Issachar show there were eighty-seven thousand fighting men.

6.verse: Benjamin’s Children - Benjamin had three sons: Bela, Beker, and Jediael.

7.verse: Bela had five sons: Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri, and they were leaders of their families. Their family history shows they had twenty-two thousand thirty-four fighting men.

8.verse: Beker’s sons were Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. They all were Beker’s sons.

9.verse: Their family history listed the family leaders and twenty thousand two hundred fighting men.

10.verse: Jediael’s son was Bilhan. Bilhan’s sons were Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Kenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.

11.verse: All these sons of Jediael were leaders of their families. They had seventeen thousand two hundred fighting men ready to serve in the army.

12.verse: The Shuppites and Huppites were descendants of Ir, and the Hushites were descendants of Aher.

13.verse: Naphtali’s Children - Naphtali’s sons were Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem. They were Bilhah’s grandsons.

14.verse: Manasseh’s Children - These are Manasseh’s descendants. Manasseh had an Aramean slave woman, who was the mother of Asriel and Makir. Makir was Gilead’s father.

15.verse: Makir took a wife from the Huppites and Shuppites. His sister was named Maacah. His second son was named Zelophehad, and he had only daughters.

16.verse: Makir’s wife Maacah had a son whom she named Peresh. Peresh’s brother was named Sheresh. Sheresh’s sons were Ulam and Rakem.

17.verse: Ulam’s son was Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead, who was the son of Makir. Makir was Manasseh’s son.

18.verse: Makir’s sister Hammoleketh gave birth to Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.

19.verse: The sons of Shemida were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.

20.verse: Ephraim’s Children - These are the names of Ephraim’s descendants. Ephraim’s son was Shuthelah. Shuthelah’s son was Bered. Bered’s son was Tahath. Tahath’s son was Eleadah. Eleadah’s son was Tahath.

21.verse: Tahath’s son was Zabad. Zabad’s son was Shuthelah. Ezer and Elead went to Gath to steal cows and sheep and were killed by some men who grew up in that city.

22.verse: Their father Ephraim cried for them many days, and his family came to comfort him.

23.verse: Then he had sexual relations with his wife again. She became pregnant and gave birth to a son whom Ephraim named Beriah because of the trouble that had happened to his family.

24.verse: Ephraim’s daughter was Sheerah. She built Lower Beth Horon, Upper Beth Horon, and Uzzen Sheerah.

25.verse: Rephah was Ephraim’s son. Resheph was Rephah’s son. Telah was Resheph’s son. Tahan was Telah’s son.

26.verse: Ladan was Tahan’s son. Ammihud was Ladan’s son. Elishama was Ammihud’s son.

27.verse: Nun was Elishama’s son, and Joshua was the son of Nun.

28.verse: Ephraim’s descendants lived in these lands and towns: Bethel and the villages near it, Naaran on the east, Gezer and the villages near it on the west, and Shechem and the villages near it. These villages went all the way to Ayyah and its villages.

29.verse: Along the borders of Manasseh’s land were the towns of Beth Shan, Taanach, Megiddo, and Dor, and the villages near them. The descendants of Joseph son of Israel lived in these towns.

30.verse: Asher’s Children - Asher’s sons were Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah. Their sister was Serah.

31.verse: Beriah’s sons were Heber and Malkiel. Malkiel was Birzaith’s father.

32.verse: Heber was the father of Japhlet, Shomer, Hotham, and their sister Shua.

33.verse: Japhlet’s sons were Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. They were Japhlet’s children.

34.verse: Japhlet’s brother was Shomer. Shomer’s sons were Rohgah, Hubbah, and Aram.

35.verse: Shomer’s brother was Hotham. Hotham’s sons were Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.

36.verse: Zophah’s sons were Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,

37.verse: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.

38.verse: Jether’s sons were Jephunneh, Pispah, and Ara.

39.verse: Ulla’s sons were Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.

40.verse: All these men were descendants of Asher and leaders of their families. They were powerful warriors and outstanding leaders. Their family history lists that they had twenty-six thousand soldiers ready to serve in the army.

1.verse: The Family History of King Saul - Benjamin was the father of Bela, his first son. Ashbel was his second son, Aharah was his third,

2.verse: Nohah was his fourth, and Rapha was his fifth son.

3.verse: Bela’s sons were Addar, Gera, Abihud,

4.verse: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,

5.verse: Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.

6.verse: These were the descendants of Ehud and leaders of their families in Geba. They were forced to move to Manahath.

7.verse: Ehud’s descendants were Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera. Gera forced them to leave. He was the father of Uzza and Ahihud.

8.verse: Shaharaim and his wife Hushim had sons named Abitub and Elpaal. In Moab, Shaharaim divorced his wives Hushim and Baara. Shaharaim and his wife Hodesh had these sons: Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam, Jeuz, Sakia, and Mirmah. They were leaders of their families.

9.verse: Shaharaim and his wife Hushim had sons named Abitub and Elpaal. In Moab, Shaharaim divorced his wives Hushim and Baara. Shaharaim and his wife Hodesh had these sons: Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam, Jeuz, Sakia, and Mirmah. They were leaders of their families.

10.verse: Shaharaim and his wife Hushim had sons named Abitub and Elpaal. In Moab, Shaharaim divorced his wives Hushim and Baara. Shaharaim and his wife Hodesh had these sons: Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam, Jeuz, Sakia, and Mirmah. They were leaders of their families.

11.verse: Shaharaim and his wife Hushim had sons named Abitub and Elpaal. In Moab, Shaharaim divorced his wives Hushim and Baara. Shaharaim and his wife Hodesh had these sons: Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam, Jeuz, Sakia, and Mirmah. They were leaders of their families.

12.verse: Elpaal’s sons were Eber, Misham, Shemed, Beriah, and Shema. Shemed built the towns of Ono and Lod and the villages around them. Beriah and Shema were leaders of the families living in Aijalon, and they forced out the people who lived in Gath.

13.verse: Elpaal’s sons were Eber, Misham, Shemed, Beriah, and Shema. Shemed built the towns of Ono and Lod and the villages around them. Beriah and Shema were leaders of the families living in Aijalon, and they forced out the people who lived in Gath.

14.verse: Beriah’s sons were Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth,

15.verse: Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,

16.verse: Michael, Ishpah, and Joha.

17.verse: Elpaal’s sons were Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,

18.verse: Ishmerai, Izliah, and Jobab.

19.verse: Shimei’s sons were Jakim, Zicri, Zabdi,

20.verse: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,

21.verse: Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath.

22.verse: Shashak’s sons were Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,

23.verse: Abdon, Zicri, Hanan,

24.verse: Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,

25.verse: Iphdeiah, and Penuel.

26.verse: Jeroham’s sons were Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,

28.verse: The family histories show that all these men were leaders of their families and lived in Jerusalem.

29.verse: Jeiel lived in the town of Gibeon, where he was the leader. His wife was named Maacah.

30.verse: Jeiel’s first son was Abdon. His other sons were Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,

32.verse: and Mikloth. Mikloth was the father of Shimeah. These sons also lived near their relatives in Jerusalem.

33.verse: Ner was the father of Kish. Kish was the father of Saul, and Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malki-Shua, Abinadab, and Esh-Baal.

34.verse: Jonathan’s son was Merib-Baal, who was the father of Micah.

35.verse: Micah’s sons were Pithon, Melech, Tarea, and Ahaz.

36.verse: Ahaz was the father of Jehoaddah. Jehoaddah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri was the father of Moza.

37.verse: Moza was the father of Binea. Raphah was Binea’s son. Eleasah was Raphah’s son, and Azel was Eleasah’s son.

38.verse: Azel had six sons: Azrikam, Bokeru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were Azel’s sons.

39.verse: Azel’s brother was Eshek. Eshek’s first son was Ulam, his second was Jeush, and Eliphelet was his third.

40.verse: Ulam’s sons were mighty warriors and good archers. They had many sons and grandsons—one hundred fifty of them in all. All these men were Benjamin’s descendants.

1.verse: The names of all the people of Israel were listed in their family histories, and those family histories were put in the book of the kings of Israel. The People in Jerusalem - The people of Judah were captured and forced to go to Babylon, because they were not faithful to God.

2.verse: The first people to come back and live in their own lands and towns were some Israelites, priests, Levites, and Temple servants.

3.verse: People from the tribes of Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh lived in Jerusalem. This is a list of those people.

4.verse: There was Uthai son of Ammihud. (Ammihud was Omri’s son. Omri was Imri’s son. Imri was Bani’s son. Bani was a descendant of Perez, and Perez was Judah’s son.)

5.verse: Of the Shilonite people there were Asaiah and his sons. Asaiah was the oldest son in his family.

6.verse: Of the Zerahite people there were Jeuel and other relatives of Zerah. There were six hundred ninety of them in all.

7.verse: From the tribe of Benjamin there was Sallu son of Meshullam. (Meshullam was Hodaviah’s son, and Hodaviah was Hassenuah’s son.)

8.verse: There was also Ibneiah son of Jeroham and Elah son of Uzzi. (Uzzi was Micri’s son.) And there was Meshullam son of Shephatiah. (Shephatiah was Reuel’s son, and Reuel was Ibnijah’s son.)

9.verse: The family history of Benjamin lists nine hundred fifty-six people living in Jerusalem, and all these were leaders of their families.

10.verse: Of the priests there were Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, Jakin, and

11.verse: Azariah son of Hilkiah. (Hilkiah was Meshullam’s son. Meshullam was Zadok’s son. Zadok was Meraioth’s son. Meraioth was Ahitub’s son. Ahitub was the officer responsible for the Temple of God.)

12.verse: Also there was Adaiah son of Jeroham. (Jeroham was Pashhur’s son, and Pashhur was Malkijah’s son.) And there was Maasai son of Adiel. (Adiel was Jahzerah’s son. Jahzerah was Meshullam’s son. Meshullam was Meshillemith’s son, and Meshillemith was Immer’s son.)

13.verse: There were one thousand seven hundred sixty priests. They were leaders of their families, and they were responsible for serving in the Temple of God.

14.verse: Of the Levites there was Shemaiah son of Hasshub. (Hasshub was Azrikam’s son, and Azrikam was Hashabiah’s son. Hashabiah was from the family of Merari.)

15.verse: There were also Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mattaniah son of Mica. (Mica was Zicri’s son, and Zicri was Asaph’s son.)

16.verse: There was also Obadiah son of Shemaiah. (Shemaiah was Galal’s son, and Galal was Jeduthun’s son.) And there was Berekiah son of Asa. (Asa was the son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.)

17.verse: Of the gatekeepers there were Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and their relatives. Shallum was their leader.

18.verse: These gatekeepers from the tribe of Levi still stand next to the King’s Gate on the east side of the city.

19.verse: Shallum was Kore’s son. Kore was Ebiasaph’s son, and Ebiasaph was Korah’s son. Shallum and his relatives from the family of Korah were gatekeepers and were responsible for guarding the gates of the Temple. Their ancestors had also been responsible for guarding the entrance to the Temple of the LORD.

20.verse: In the past Phinehas, Eleazar’s son, was in charge of the gatekeepers, and the LORD was with Phinehas.

21.verse: Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was the gatekeeper at the entrance to the Temple.

22.verse: In all, two hundred twelve men were chosen to guard the gates, and their names were written in their family histories in their villages. David and Samuel the seer chose these men because they were dependable.

23.verse: The gatekeepers and their descendants had to guard the gates of the Temple of the LORD. (The Temple took the place of the Holy Tent.)

24.verse: There were gatekeepers on all four sides of the Temple: east, west, north, and south.

25.verse: The gatekeepers’ relatives who lived in the villages had to come and help them at times. Each time they came they helped the gatekeepers for seven days.

26.verse: Because they were dependable, four gatekeepers were made the leaders of all the gatekeepers. They were Levites, and they were responsible for the rooms and treasures in the Temple of God.

27.verse: They stayed up all night guarding the Temple of God, and they opened it every morning.

28.verse: Some of the gatekeepers were responsible for the utensils used in the Temple services. They counted these utensils when people took them out and when they brought them back.

29.verse: Other gatekeepers were chosen to take care of the furniture and utensils in the Holy Place. They also took care of the flour, wine, oil, incense, and spices,

30.verse: but some of the priests took care of mixing the spices.

31.verse: There was a Levite named Mattithiah who was dependable and had the job of baking the bread used for the offerings. He was the first son of Shallum, who was from the family of Korah.

32.verse: Some of the gatekeepers from the Kohath family had the job of preparing the special bread that was put on the table every Sabbath day.

33.verse: Some of the Levites were musicians in the Temple. The leaders of these families stayed in the rooms of the Temple. Since they were on duty day and night, they did not do other work in the Temple.

34.verse: These are the leaders of the Levite families. Their names were listed in their family histories, and they lived in Jerusalem.

35.verse: The Family History of King Saul - Jeiel lived in the town of Gibeon, where he was the leader. His wife was named Maacah.

36.verse: Jeiel’s first son was Abdon. His other sons were Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,

38.verse: Mikloth was Shimeam’s father. Jeiel’s family lived near their relatives in Jerusalem.

39.verse: Ner was Kish’s father. Kish was Saul’s father. Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malki-Shua, Abinadab, and Esh-Baal.

40.verse: Jonathan’s son was Merib-Baal, who was the father of Micah.

41.verse: Micah’s sons were Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.

42.verse: Ahaz was Jadah’s father. Jadah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri was Moza’s father.

43.verse: Moza was Binea’s father. Rephaiah was Binea’s son. Eleasah was Rephaiah’s son, and Azel was Eleasah’s son.

44.verse: Azel had six sons: Azrikam, Bokeru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. They were Azel’s sons.

1.verse: The Death of King Saul - The Philistines fought against Israel, and the Israelites ran away from them. Many Israelites were killed on Mount Gilboa.

2.verse: The Philistines fought hard against Saul and his sons, killing his sons Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malki-Shua.

3.verse: The fighting was heavy around Saul, and the archers shot him with their arrows and wounded him.

4.verse: Then Saul said to the officer who carried his armor, “Pull out your sword and stab me. If you don’t, these Philistines who are not circumcised will come and hurt me.” But Saul’s officer refused, because he was afraid. So Saul took his own sword and threw himself on it.

5.verse: When the officer saw that Saul was dead, he threw himself on his own sword and died.

6.verse: So Saul and three of his sons died; all his family died together.

7.verse: When the Israelites living in the valley saw that their army had run away and that Saul and his sons were dead, they left their towns and ran away. Then the Philistines came and settled in them.

8.verse: The next day when the Philistines came to strip the dead soldiers, they found Saul and his sons dead on Mount Gilboa.

9.verse: The Philistines stripped Saul’s body and took his head and his armor. Then they sent messengers through all their country to tell the news to their idols and to their people.

10.verse: The Philistines put Saul’s armor in the temple of their idols and hung his head in the temple of Dagon.

11.verse: All the people in Jabesh Gilead heard what the Philistines had done to Saul.

12.verse: So the brave men of Jabesh went and got the bodies of Saul and his sons and brought them to Jabesh. They buried their bones under the large tree in Jabesh. Then the people of Jabesh fasted for seven days.

13.verse: Saul died because he was not faithful to the LORD and did not obey the LORD. He even went to a medium and asked her for advice

14.verse: instead of asking the LORD. This is why the LORD put Saul to death and gave the kingdom to Jesse’s son David.

1.verse: David Becomes King - Then the people of Israel came to David at the town of Hebron and said, “Look, we are your own family.

2.verse: Even when Saul was king, you were the one who led Israel in battle. The LORD your God said to you, ‘You will be the shepherd for my people Israel. You will be their leader.’”

3.verse: So all the elders of Israel came to King David at Hebron. He made an agreement with them in Hebron in the presence of the LORD. Then they poured oil on David to make him king over Israel. The LORD had promised through Samuel that this would happen.

4.verse: David Captures Jerusalem - David and all the Israelites went to the city of Jerusalem. At that time Jerusalem was called Jebus, and the people living there were named Jebusites.

5.verse: They said to David, “You can’t get inside our city.” But David did take the city of Jerusalem with its strong walls, and it became the City of David.

6.verse: David had said, “The person who leads the attack against the Jebusites will become the commander over all my army.” Joab son of Zeruiah led the attack, so he became the commander of the army.

7.verse: Then David made his home in the strong, walled city, which is why it was named the City of David.

8.verse: David rebuilt the city, beginning where the land was filled in and going to the wall that was around the city. Joab repaired the other parts of the city.

9.verse: David became stronger and stronger, and the LORD All-Powerful was with him.

10.verse: David’s Mighty Warriors - This is a list of the leaders over David’s warriors who helped make David’s kingdom strong. All the people of Israel also supported David’s kingdom. These heroes and all the people of Israel made David king, just as the LORD had promised.

11.verse: This is a list of David’s warriors: Jashobeam was from the Hacmonite people. He was the head of the Three, David’s most powerful soldiers. He used his spear to fight three hundred men at one time, and he killed them all.

12.verse: Next was Eleazar, one of the Three. Eleazar was Dodai’s son from the Ahohite people.

13.verse: Eleazar was with David at Pas Dammim when the Philistines came there to fight. There was a field of barley at that place. The Israelites ran away from the Philistines,

14.verse: but they stopped in the middle of that field and fought for it and killed the Philistines. The LORD gave them a great victory.

15.verse: Once, three of the Thirty, David’s chief soldiers, came down to him at the rock by the cave near Adullam. At the same time the Philistine army had camped in the Valley of Rephaim.

16.verse: At that time David was in a stronghold, and some of the Philistines were in Bethlehem.

17.verse: David had a strong desire for some water. He said, “Oh, I wish someone would get me water from the well near the city gate of Bethlehem!”

18.verse: So the Three broke through the Philistine army and took water from the well near the city gate in Bethlehem. Then they brought it to David, but he refused to drink it. He poured it out before the LORD,

19.verse: saying, “May God keep me from drinking this water! It would be like drinking the blood of the men who risked their lives to bring it to me!” So David refused to drink it. These were the brave things that the three warriors did.

20.verse: Abishai brother of Joab was the captain of the Three. Abishai fought three hundred soldiers with his spear and killed them. He became as famous as the Three

21.verse: and was more honored than the Three. He became their commander even though he was not one of them.

22.verse: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a brave fighter from Kabzeel who did mighty things. He killed two of the best warriors from Moab. He also went down into a pit and killed a lion on a snowy day.

23.verse: Benaiah killed an Egyptian who was about seven and one-half feet tall and had a spear as large as a weaver’s rod. Benaiah had a club, but he grabbed the spear from the Egyptian’s hand and killed him with his own spear.

24.verse: These were the things Benaiah son of Jehoiada did. He was as famous as the Three.

25.verse: He received more honor than the Thirty, but he did not become a member of the Three. David made him leader of his bodyguards.

26.verse: The Thirty Chief Soldiers - These were also mighty warriors: Asahel brother of Joab; Elhanan son of Dodo from Bethlehem;

27.verse: Shammoth the Harorite; Helez the Pelonite;

28.verse: Ira son of Ikkesh from Tekoa; Abiezer the Anathothite;

29.verse: Sibbecai the Hushathite; Ilai the Ahohite;

30.verse: Maharai the Netophathite; Heled son of Baanah the Netophathite;

31.verse: Ithai son of Ribai from Gibeah in Benjamin; Benaiah the Pirathonite;

32.verse: Hurai from the ravines of Gaash; Abiel the Arbathite;

33.verse: Azmaveth the Baharumite; Eliahba the Shaalbonite;

34.verse: the sons of Hashem the Gizonite; Jonathan son of Shagee the Hararite;

35.verse: Ahiam son of Sacar the Hararite; Eliphal son of Ur;

36.verse: Hepher the Mekerathite; Ahijah the Pelonite;

37.verse: Hezro the Carmelite; Naarai son of Ezbai;

38.verse: Joel brother of Nathan; Mibhar son of Hagri;

39.verse: Zelek the Ammonite; Naharai the Berothite, the officer who carried the armor for Joab son of Zeruiah;

40.verse: Ira the Ithrite; Gareb the Ithrite;

41.verse: Uriah the Hittite; Zabad son of Ahlai;

42.verse: Adina son of Shiza the Reubenite, who was the leader of the Reubenites, and his thirty soldiers;

43.verse: Hanan son of Maacah; Joshaphat the Mithnite;

44.verse: Uzzia the Ashterathite; Shama and Jeiel sons of Hotham the Aroerite;

45.verse: Jediael son of Shimri; Joha, Jediael’s brother, the Tizite;

46.verse: Eliel the Mahavite; Jeribai and Joshaviah, Elnaam’s sons; Ithmah the Moabite;

47.verse: Eliel, Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaites.

1.verse: Warriors Join David - These were the men who came to David at Ziklag when David was hiding from Saul son of Kish. They were among the warriors who helped David in battle.

2.verse: They came with bows for weapons and could use either their right or left hands to shoot arrows or to sling rocks. They were Saul’s relatives from the tribe of Benjamin.

3.verse: Ahiezer was their leader, and there was Joash. (Ahiezer and Joash were sons of Shemaah, who was from the town of Gibeah.) There were also Jeziel and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth. There were Beracah and Jehu from the town of Anathoth.

4.verse: And there was Ishmaiah from the town of Gibeon; he was one of the Thirty. In fact, he was the leader of the Thirty. There were Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, and Jozabad from Gederah.

5.verse: There were Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, and Shemariah. There was Shephatiah from Haruph.

6.verse: There were Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, and Jashobeam from the family group of Korah.

7.verse: And there were Joelah and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham, from the town of Gedor.

8.verse: Part of the people of Gad joined David at his stronghold in the desert. They were brave warriors trained for war and skilled with shields and spears. They were as fierce as lions and as fast as gazelles over the hills.

9.verse: Ezer was the leader of Gad’s army, and Obadiah was second in command. Eliab was third,

10.verse: Mishmannah was fourth, Jeremiah was fifth,

11.verse: Attai was sixth, Eliel was seventh,

12.verse: Johanan was eighth, Elzabad was ninth,

13.verse: Jeremiah was tenth, and Macbannai was eleventh in command.

14.verse: They were the commanders of the army from Gad. The least of these leaders was in charge of a hundred soldiers, and the greatest was in charge of a thousand.

15.verse: They crossed the Jordan River and chased away the people living in the valleys, to the east and to the west. This happened in the first month of the year when the Jordan floods the valley.

16.verse: Other people from the tribes of Benjamin and Judah also came to David at his stronghold.

17.verse: David went out to meet them and said to them, “If you have come peacefully to help me, I welcome you. Join me. But if you have come to turn me over to my enemies, even though I have done nothing wrong, the God of our ancestors will see this and punish you.”

18.verse: Then the Spirit entered Amasai, the leader of the Thirty, and he said: “We belong to you, David. We are with you, son of Jesse. Success, success to you. Success to those who help you, because your God helps you.” So David welcomed these men and made them leaders of his army.

19.verse: Some of the men from Manasseh also joined David when he went with the Philistines to fight Saul. But David and his men did not really help the Philistines. After talking about it, the Philistine leaders decided to send David away. They said, “If David goes back to his master Saul, we will be killed.”

20.verse: These are the men from Manasseh who joined David when he went to Ziklag: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai. Each of them was a leader of a thousand men from Manasseh.

21.verse: All these men of Manasseh were brave soldiers, and they helped David fight against groups of men who went around the country robbing people. These soldiers became commanders in David’s army.

22.verse: Every day more men joined David, and his army became large, like the army of God.

23.verse: Others Join David at Hebron - These are the numbers of the soldiers ready for battle who joined David at Hebron. They came to help turn the kingdom of Saul over to David, just as the LORD had said.

24.verse: There were sixty-eight hundred men with their weapons from Judah. They carried shields and spears.

25.verse: There were seventy-one hundred men from Simeon. They were warriors ready for war.

26.verse: There were forty-six hundred men from Levi.

27.verse: Jehoiada, a leader from Aaron’s family, was in that group. There were thirty-seven hundred with him.

28.verse: Zadok was also in that group. He was a strong young warrior, and with him came twenty-two leaders from his family.

29.verse: There were three thousand men from Benjamin, who were Saul’s relatives. Most of them had remained loyal to Saul’s family until then.

30.verse: There were twenty thousand eight hundred men from Ephraim. They were brave warriors and were famous men in their own family groups.

31.verse: There were eighteen thousand men from West Manasseh. Each one was especially chosen to make David king.

32.verse: There were two hundred leaders from Issachar. They knew what Israel should do, and they knew the right time to do it. Their relatives were with them and under their command.

33.verse: There were fifty thousand men from Zebulun. They were trained soldiers and knew how to use every kind of weapon of war. They followed David completely.

34.verse: There were one thousand officers from Naphtali. They had thirty-seven thousand soldiers with them who carried shields and spears.

35.verse: There were twenty-eight thousand six hundred men from Dan, who were ready for war.

36.verse: There were forty thousand trained soldiers from Asher, who were ready for war.

37.verse: There were one hundred twenty thousand soldiers from the east side of the Jordan River from the people of Reuben, Gad, and East Manasseh. They had every kind of weapon.

38.verse: All these fighting men were ready to go to war. They came to Hebron fully agreed to make David king of all Israel. All the other Israelites also agreed to make David king.

39.verse: They spent three days there with David, eating and drinking, because their relatives had prepared food for them.

40.verse: Also, their neighbors came from as far away as Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali, bringing food on donkeys, camels, mules, and oxen. They brought much flour, fig cakes, raisins, wine, oil, cows, and sheep, because the people of Israel were very happy.

1.verse: Bringing Back the Ark - David talked with all the officers of his army, the commanders of a hundred men and the commanders of a thousand men.

2.verse: Then David called the people of Israel together and said, “If you think it is a good idea, and if it is what the LORD our God wants, let’s send a message. Let’s tell our fellow Israelites in all the areas of Israel and the priests and Levites living with them in their towns and pastures to come and join us.

3.verse: Let’s bring the Ark of our God back to us. We did not use it to ask God for help while Saul was king.”

4.verse: All the people agreed with David, because they all thought it was the right thing to do.

5.verse: So David gathered all the Israelites, from the Shihor River in Egypt to Lebo Hamath, to bring the Ark of God back from the town of Kiriath Jearim.

6.verse: David and all the Israelites with him went to Baalah of Judah, which is Kiriath Jearim, to get the Ark of God the LORD. God’s throne is between the golden, winged creatures on the Ark, and the Ark is called by his name.

7.verse: The people carried the Ark of God from Abinadab’s house on a new cart, and Uzzah and Ahio guided it.

8.verse: David and all the Israelites were celebrating in the presence of God. With all their strength they were singing and playing lyres, harps, tambourines, cymbals, and trumpets.

9.verse: When David’s men came to the threshing floor of Kidon, the oxen stumbled, and Uzzah reached out his hand to steady the Ark.

10.verse: The LORD was angry with Uzzah and killed him, because he had touched the Ark. So Uzzah died there in the presence of God.

11.verse: David was angry because the LORD had punished Uzzah in his anger. Now that place is called The Punishment of Uzzah.

12.verse: David was afraid of God that day and asked, “How can I bring the Ark of God home to me?”

13.verse: So David did not take the Ark with him to Jerusalem. Instead, he took it to the house of Obed-Edom who was from Gath.

14.verse: The Ark of God stayed with Obed-Edom’s family in his house for three months, and the LORD blessed Obed-Edom’s family and everything he owned.

1.verse: David’s Kingdom Grows - Hiram king of the city of Tyre sent messengers to David. He also sent cedar logs, bricklayers, and carpenters to build a palace for David.

2.verse: Then David knew that the LORD really had made him king of Israel and that he had made his kingdom great. The LORD did this because he loved his people Israel.

3.verse: David married more women in Jerusalem and had more sons and daughters.

4.verse: These are the names of David’s children born in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,

5.verse: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,

6.verse: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,

7.verse: Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.

8.verse: David Defeats the Philistines - When the Philistines heard that David had been made king of all Israel, they went to look for him. But David heard about it and went out to fight them.

9.verse: The Philistines had attacked and robbed the people in the Valley of Rephaim.

10.verse: David asked God, “Should I go and attack the Philistines? Will you hand them over to me?” The LORD answered him, “Go, I will hand them over to you.”

11.verse: So David and his men went up to the town of Baal Perazim and defeated the Philistines. David said, “Like a flood of water, God has broken through my enemies by using me.” So that place was named Baal Perazim.

12.verse: The Philistines had left their idols there, so David ordered his men to burn them.

13.verse: Soon the Philistines attacked the people in the valley again.

14.verse: David prayed to God again, and God answered him, saying, “Don’t attack the Philistines from the front. Instead, go around them and attack them in front of the balsam trees.

15.verse: When you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam trees, then attack. I, God, will have gone out before you to defeat the Philistine army.”

16.verse: David did as God commanded, and he and his men defeated the Philistine army all the way from Gibeon to Gezer.

17.verse: So David became famous in all the countries, and the LORD made all nations afraid of him.

1.verse: The Ark Is Brought to Jerusalem - David built houses for himself in Jerusalem. Then he prepared a place for the Ark of God, and he set up a tent for it.

2.verse: David said, “Only the Levites may carry the Ark of God. The LORD chose them to carry the Ark of the LORD and to serve him forever.”

3.verse: David called all the people of Israel to come to Jerusalem. He wanted to bring the Ark of the LORD to the place he had made for it.

4.verse: David called together the descendants of Aaron and the Levites.

5.verse: There were one hundred twenty people from Kohath’s family group, with Uriel as their leader.

6.verse: There were two hundred twenty people from Merari’s family group, with Asaiah as their leader.

7.verse: There were one hundred thirty people from Gershon’s family group, with Joel as their leader.

8.verse: There were two hundred people from Elizaphan’s family group, with Shemaiah as their leader.

9.verse: There were eighty people from Hebron’s family group, with Eliel as their leader.

10.verse: And there were one hundred twelve people from Uzziel’s family group, with Amminadab as their leader.

11.verse: Then David asked the priests Zadok and Abiathar and these Levites to come to him: Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.

12.verse: David said to them, “You are the leaders of the families of Levi. You and the other Levites must give yourselves for service to the LORD. Bring up the Ark of the LORD, the God of Israel, to the place I have made for it.

13.verse: The last time we did not ask the LORD how to carry it. You Levites didn’t carry it, so the LORD our God punished us.”

14.verse: Then the priests and Levites prepared themselves for service to the LORD so they could carry the Ark of the LORD, the God of Israel.

15.verse: The Levites used special poles to carry the Ark of God on their shoulders, as Moses had commanded, just as the LORD had said they should.

16.verse: David told the leaders of the Levites to appoint their brothers as singers to play their lyres, harps, and cymbals and to sing happy songs.

17.verse: So the Levites appointed Heman and his relatives Asaph and Ethan. Heman was Joel’s son. Asaph was Berekiah’s son. And Ethan, from the Merari family group, was Kushaiah’s son.

18.verse: There was also a second group of Levites: Zechariah, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel. They were the Levite guards.

19.verse: The singers Heman, Asaph, and Ethan played bronze cymbals.

20.verse: Zechariah, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah played the lyres.

21.verse: Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah played the harps.

22.verse: The Levite leader Kenaniah was in charge of the singing, because he was very good at it.

23.verse: Berekiah and Elkanah were two of the guards for the Ark of the Agreement.

24.verse: The priests Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer had the job of blowing trumpets in front of the Ark of God. Obed-Edom and Jehiah were also guards for the Ark.

25.verse: David, the leaders of Israel, and the commanders of a thousand soldiers went to get the Ark of the Agreement with the LORD. They all went to bring the Ark from Obed-Edom’s house with great joy.

26.verse: Because God helped the Levites who carried the Ark of the Agreement with the LORD, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven male sheep.

27.verse: All the Levites who carried the Ark, and Kenaniah, the man in charge of the singing, and all the singers wore robes of fine linen. David also wore a robe of fine linen and a holy vest of fine linen.

28.verse: So all the people of Israel brought up the Ark of the Agreement with the LORD. They shouted, blew horns and trumpets, and played cymbals, lyres, and harps.

29.verse: As the Ark of the Agreement with the LORD entered Jerusalem, Saul’s daughter Michal watched from a window. When she saw King David dancing and celebrating, she hated him.

1.verse: They brought the Ark of God and put it inside the tent that David had set up for it. Then they offered burnt offerings and fellowship offerings to God.

2.verse: When David had finished giving the burnt offerings and fellowship offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.

3.verse: He gave a loaf of bread, some dates, and raisins to every Israelite man and woman.

4.verse: Then David appointed some of the Levites to serve before the Ark of the LORD. They had the job of leading the worship and giving thanks and praising the LORD, the God of Israel.

5.verse: Asaph, who played the cymbals, was the leader. Zechariah was second to him. The other Levites were Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel. They played the lyres and harps.

6.verse: Benaiah and Jahaziel were priests who blew the trumpets regularly before the Ark of the Agreement with God.

7.verse: That day David first gave Asaph and his relatives the job of singing praises to the LORD.

8.verse: David’s Song of Thanks - Give thanks to the LORD and pray to him. Tell the nations what he has done.

9.verse: Sing to him; sing praises to him. Tell about all his miracles.

10.verse: Be glad that you are his; let those who seek the LORD be happy.

11.verse: Depend on the LORD and his strength; always go to him for help.

12.verse: Remember the miracles he has done, his wonders, and his decisions.

13.verse: You are the descendants of his servant, Israel; you are the children of Jacob, his chosen people.

14.verse: He is the LORD our God. His laws are for all the world.

15.verse: He will keep his agreement forever; he will keep his promises always.

16.verse: He will keep the agreement he made with Abraham and the promise he made to Isaac.

17.verse: He made it a law for the people of Jacob; he made it an agreement with Israel to last forever.

18.verse: He said, “I will give the land of Canaan to you, to belong to you.”

19.verse: Then God’s people were few in number, and they were strangers in the land.

20.verse: They went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another.

21.verse: But he did not let anyone hurt them; he warned kings not to harm them.

22.verse: He said, “Don’t touch my chosen people, and don’t harm my prophets.”

23.verse: Sing to the LORD, all the earth. Every day tell how he saves us.

24.verse: Tell the nations about his glory; tell all peoples the miracles he does.

25.verse: The LORD is great; he should be praised. He should be respected more than all the gods.

26.verse: All the gods of the nations are only idols, but the LORD made the skies.

27.verse: He has glory and majesty; he has power and joy in his Temple.

28.verse: Praise the LORD, all nations on earth. Praise the LORD’s glory and power;

29.verse: praise the glory of the LORD’s name. Bring an offering and come to him. Worship the LORD because he is holy.

30.verse: Tremble before him, everyone on earth. The earth is set, and it cannot be moved.

31.verse: Let the skies rejoice and the earth be glad. Let people everywhere say, “The LORD is king!”

32.verse: Let the sea and everything in it shout; let the fields and everything in them rejoice.

33.verse: Then the trees of the forest will sing for joy before the LORD. They will sing because he is coming to judge the world.

34.verse: Thank the LORD because he is good. His love continues forever.

35.verse: Say to him, “Save us, God our Savior, and bring us back and save us from other nations. Then we will thank you and will gladly praise you.”

36.verse: Praise the LORD, the God of Israel. He always was and always will be. All the people said “Amen” and praised the LORD.

37.verse: Then David left Asaph and the other Levites there in front of the Ark of the Agreement with the LORD. They were to serve there every day.

38.verse: David also left Obed-Edom and sixty-eight other Levites to serve with them. Hosah and Obed-Edom son of Jeduthun were guards.

39.verse: David left Zadok the priest and the other priests who served with him in front of the Tent of the LORD at the place of worship in Gibeon.

40.verse: Every morning and evening they offered burnt offerings on the altar of burnt offerings, following the rules written in the Teachings of the LORD, which he had given Israel.

41.verse: With them were Heman and Jeduthun and other Levites. They were chosen by name to sing praises to the LORD because his love continues forever.

42.verse: Heman and Jeduthun also had the job of playing the trumpets and cymbals and other musical instruments when songs were sung to God. Jeduthun’s sons guarded the gates.

43.verse: Then all the people left. Each person went home, and David also went home to bless the people in his home.

1.verse: God’s Promise to David - When David moved into his palace, he said to Nathan the prophet, “Look, I am living in a palace made of cedar, but the Ark of the Agreement with the LORD sits in a tent.”

2.verse: Nathan said to David, “Do what you want to do, because God is with you.”

3.verse: But that night God spoke his word to Nathan, saying,

4.verse: “Go and tell David my servant, ‘This is what the LORD says: You are not the person to build a house for me to live in.

5.verse: From the time I brought Israel out of Egypt until now I have not lived in a house. I have moved from one tent site to another and from one place to another.

6.verse: As I have moved with the Israelites to different places, I have never said to the leaders, whom I commanded to take care of my people, “Why haven’t you built me a house of cedar?”’

7.verse: “Now, tell my servant David: ‘This is what the LORD All-Powerful says: I took you from the pasture and from tending the sheep and made you king of my people Israel.

8.verse: I have been with you everywhere you have gone. I have defeated your enemies for you. I will make you as famous as any of the great people on the earth.

9.verse: I will choose a place for my people Israel, and I will plant them so they can live in their own homes. They will not be bothered anymore. Wicked people will no longer hurt them as they have in the past

10.verse: when I chose judges for my people Israel. I will defeat all your enemies. “‘I tell you that the LORD will make your descendants kings of Israel after you.

11.verse: When you die and join your ancestors, I will make one of your sons the new king, and I will set up his kingdom.

12.verse: He will build a house for me, and I will let his kingdom rule always.

13.verse: I will be his father, and he will be my son. I took away my love from Saul, who ruled before you, but I will never stop loving your son.

14.verse: I will put him in charge of my house and kingdom forever. His family will rule forever.’”

15.verse: Nathan told David everything God had said in this vision.

16.verse: David Prays to God - Then King David went in and sat in front of the LORD. David said, “LORD God, who am I? What is my family? Why did you bring me to this point?

17.verse: But that was not enough for you, God. You have also made promises about my future family. LORD God, you have treated me like a very important person.

18.verse: “What more can I say to you for honoring me, your servant? You know me so well.

19.verse: LORD, you have done this wonderful thing for my sake and because you wanted to. You have made known all these great things.

20.verse: “There is no one like you, LORD. There is no God except you. We have heard all this ourselves!

21.verse: There is no nation like your people Israel. They are the only people on earth that God chose to be his own. You made your name well known by the great and wonderful things you did for them. You went ahead of them and forced other nations out of the land. You freed your people from slavery in Egypt.

22.verse: You made the people of Israel your very own people forever, and, LORD, you are their God.
